business.headline: Crypto crash wipes out $19 billion after Trump's 100% China tariffs spark sell-offThe cryptocurrency market suffered a historic crash after US President Donald Trump announced 100% tariffs on China and new export controls on software.

Crisis brews at Bira 91: How a name change shook the popular beer brandFrom beer icon to regulatory nightmare, Bira 91's journey shows how a minor administrative tweak can spiral into financial chaos, employee unrest, and investor anxiety.

LG Electronics vs Tata Capital IPO: What should be your strategy post-listing?Two IPOs, two very different strategies. Tata Capital offers steady long-term growth, while LG Electronics promises quick listing gains. Read on to plan post-listing moves and investment approach carefully.

LG Electronics IPO allotment is finally out. How much listing gain you can expect?Investors who received allotments may be sitting on potential listing gains of Rs 5,000–Rs 6,000 per lot, depending on market sentiment at the time of debut.

Anil Ambani aide and senior Reliance Power executive arrested by EDThe arrest of Ashok Pal, who serves as the executive director at Reliance Power, is related to a suspected fake bank guarantee racket worth Rs 68.2 crore.

Tata History: When Nehru, Jinnah, and Bose allied to save steel companyStarting as a company trading in cotton and opium, the Tata Group has weathered colonial economic warfare, nationalist politics, labor upheaval, and insurgent crises. But it has always emerged stronger through vision, sacrifice, and resilience. In the final episode of our series on the group, we revisit two storms that threatened to sink the Tata brand and image.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as financial stocks rally; Cipla, SBI among top gainersSensex ends 328 points higher, Nifty above 25,250; Cipla, SBI lead gains

Convenience or debt trap? The hidden cost of BPNL, easy credit and festive offersEvery festive season, easy credit makes everything—from gadgets to holidays—look affordable. But behind the glitter of BNPL schemes and "no-cost EMIs" lies a growing debt trap that's quietly eroding financial freedom.

Tata Trusts trustee Vijay Singh calls internal rift unprecedented: ReportVijay Singh, who serves as a trustee and vice-chairman of Tata Trusts, said that the act of voting on internal matters went against the long-standing principles followed during Ratan Tata's leadership.

WeWork India slips 5% in debut trade amid valuation, governance concernsCorporate governance firm InGovern warned investors of WeWork India's fragile financials, negative cash flow, high lease liabilities, and the absence of fresh capital infusion.

Buy, borrow, die: The wealth cheat code the rich don't share, explains CAEver wondered how wealthy families keep growing their wealth while others struggle with taxes and inflation? CA reveals a simple three-step strategy: Buy, Borrow, Die. Have a look.

LG Electronics IPO GMP touches Rs 400: Here's how to check allotment statusLG IPO: The GMP is an indicator of market sentiment, showing the expected difference between the IPO price and the likely listing price. With the upper price band set at Rs 1,140, a GMP of Rs 400 suggests the shares could debut at around Rs 1,540, implying potential listing gains of roughly 35%.
TCS reports 20,000 layoffs, employees' advocacy group questions transparencyThe IT giant's employee strength fell from 6,13,069 on June 30 to 5,93,314, according to Q2FY26 data posted on its website.

Stopping PF contributions? What it means for your retirement savingsPausing your PF contributions may seem harmless, but it can slow down your retirement savings. Even if your money stays safe, missing deposits could mean losing valuable interest and tax benefits over time.

What's brewing at Bira 91? Over 250 employees seek removal of founder, says reportEmployees cited "corporate governance failure, lack of transparency, delays in salaries and dues," as well as cases filed by creditors indicating deteriorating financials and pending vendor payments.

Tata Capital IPO vs LG IPO GMP: Which one is likely to give better returns? Tata Capital's IPO, priced between Rs 310–Rs 326, shows modest grey market premiums of Rs 6–Rs 7, indicating limited listing gains. LG Electronics India's IPO, at Rs 1,140, boasts Rs 380 GMP, suggesting strong upside.

Bitcoin slips again. 3 reasons why the crypto market is downBitcoin's price has slipped again this week, signalling renewed volatility in the digital asset space. From rising US inflation worries to ETF outflows, here's what's dragging crypto prices lower.

The legacy of Tata Trusts, beyond the boardroomTata Trusts is one of India's oldest, largest, and most influential philanthropic foundations.  A group of public charitable trusts set up by members of the Tata family, the present-day Trusts trace their origin to the working-class-focused JN Endowment Fund, started by Jamsetji Tata.
Sensex, Nifty trade higher after flat start as banks lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 232.01 points to 82,404.11, while the NSE Nifty50 added 70.60 points to 25,252.40 as of 9:32 am.

UK PM Keir Starmer calls Paytm the 'Superstar' of Indian fintech industryUK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said that the rise of Indian fintech companies on the world stage driven by technological innovation, digital inclusion, and entrepreneurial scale.

entertainment.headline: Diane Keaton dies at 79, Leonardo, Jane Fonda and other Hollywood celebs pay tribute Hollywood legend Diane Keaton, famous for 'Annie Hall' and 'The Godfather', passed away at 79. Celebrities like Leonardo DiCaprio, Jane Fonda, and Michael Douglas paid heartfelt tributes, remembering her iconic performances and unique personality.

The Woman In Cabin 10 review: Keira Knightley's high-seas whodunit hits rough watersRelease Date:Fri Oct 10, 2025 Netflix's latest thriller, 'The Woman in Cabin 10', follows a troubled investigative journalist aboard a luxurious yacht, unravelling a mystery that ultimately feels predictable and lacking in suspense.

Priyanka Chopra captures Nick Jonas helping with her hair, shares adorable video Priyanka Chopra shared an adorable video capturing Nick Jonas helping her with her hair at the airport, giving fans a glimpse of their playful bond.

Deepika Padukone to Allu Arjun: 5 casting controversies in pan-India films From blockbuster expectations to creative clashes, pan-India films bring together stars across industries, but not without their share of controversies, from Deepika Padukone's exits to Allu Arjun's walkouts.

Amitabh Bachchan distributes goodies to fans on his 83rd birthday. Watch Amitabh Bachchan celebrated his 83rd birthday by stepping out to greet fans, breaking his usual Sunday wave tradition, and even distributed goodies to them.

Diane Keaton no more: Priyanka to Kareena, celebs pay tribute to Hollywood icon Hollywood icon Diane Keaton, famous for 'Annie Hall' and 'The Godfather' series, died at 79, with celebrities like Priyanka Chopra, Kareena Kapoor, and Zoya Akhtar paying heartfelt tributes.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 10: Rishab Shetty's film beats Coolie and Saiyaara Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1' is unstoppable at the box office, earning Rs 396.65 crore in just 10 days and becoming the third biggest Indian hit of 2025. With strong word-of-mouth and weekend growth, the film is now close to entering the Rs 400 crore club.

Exclusive: Aditya Gadhvi's new Gujarati folk hit Meetha Khaara highlights Agariyas Aditya Gadhvi's new Gujarati folk hit 'Meetha Khaara' highlights salt farmers' struggles in Gujarat. The song continues his mission to showcase underrepresented communities through folk music.

Oscar-winning actor Diane Keaton dies at 79 Oscar-winning actress Diane Keaton, famed for Annie Hall, The Godfather, and The First Wives Club, has died at 79 in California. Her family has requested privacy as they mourn.

Filmfare Awards 2025 winners: Who took home the big trophies? Full list inside 'Laapataa Ladies', starring Pratibha Ranta and Nitanshi Goel, clinched the majority of awards at the 71st Filmfare Awards 2025. The star-studded ceremony is being held in Ahmedabad.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Salman denies favouring Amaal, exposes Tanya Actor Salman Khan addressed allegations of being partial towards singer Amaal Mallik in 'Bigg Boss 19' on Weekend Ka Vaar. He also exposed spiritual influencer Tanya Mittal's game to the rest of the contestants.

PM Modi's passion will boost archery legacy: Ram Charan after meeting Actor Ram Charan and his wife Upasana Kamineni Konidela met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the national capital on Saturday. The meeting focused on the Archery Premier League.

Ram Charan's daring mountain dance for Peddi song goes viral. Watch A video of actor Ram Charan performing a dance sequence on a rocky cliff edge has gone viral. The behind-the-scenes clip is from the sets of his much-awaited film 'Peddi.'

Punjabi folk singer Gurmeet Singh Maan dies due to heart complications Punjabi folk singer Gurmeet Singh Maan, who was also a police officer, has died. Maan's songs often reflected the traditions of rural Punjab.

Exclusive: Gulshan Devaiah on Kannada debut, Bhoota Kola, self-belief and more Actor Gulshan Devaiah, who was recently seen in 'Kantara: Chapter 1', exclusively spoke to IndiaToday.in about his experience working with Rishab Shetty, witnessing the Bhoota Kola tradition in Karnataka, his message for outsiders in the film industry, and more.

Ajay Devgn's De De Pyaar De sequel gets a release date. Check poster The sequel to 'De De Pyaar De' finally has a release date. Actor Ajay Devgn on Saturday shared the first motion poster of the upcoming film and hinted at the plot.

Felt like dream: Saira Banu recalls wedding with Dilip Kumar on 59th anniversary On their 59th wedding anniversary, veteran actor Saira Banu reminisced about her wedding night with late actor Dilip Kumar, calling it a dreamlike and joy-filled evening. She fondly recalled the simplicity, chaos, and heartfelt moments that made the day unforgettable.

Amitabh Bachchan turns 83: Prabhas to Farhan Akhtar, celebs share birthday wishes Bollywood legend Amitabh Bachchan turned 83 today, with celebrities like Shatrughan Sinha, Farhan Akhtar, Prabhas, and Srijit Mukherji sharing heartfelt birthday wishes for the megastar.

Creating something with Allu Arjun, reveals Atlee Director Atlee, said his upcoming film with Allu Arjun will be something very new, very intriguing, addictive to watch, promising a visually striking and innovative experience. The high-profile project, tentatively titled 'AA22 x A6', also stars Deepika Padukone, with speculation about other big names joining the cast.

general news.headline: Op Blue Star was wrong, Indira Gandhi paid with life for it: P ChidambaramP Chidambaram also said the decision to launch Operation Blue Star was a collective one, involving the Army, police, intelligence, and civil service, and could not be blamed solely on Indira Gandhi.

Taliban kill 12 Pakistani soldiers in cross-border clashes, seize army outpostsTaliban forces seized multiple Pakistani outposts along the Durand Line, killing 12 soldiers, in retaliatory cross-border clashes after a Pakistani airstrike in Kabul this week.

3 arrested for medical student's rape near Bengal hospital; hunt on for 2 moreWest Bengal police have arrested three men in connection with the gang-rape of a medical student near the hospital. Two others remain on the run.

Pakistan fumes over India-Afghan statement, objects to Kashmir mentionPakistan also rejected Taliban leader Amir Khan Muttaqi's claim that terrorism is solely Pakistan's internal problem, insisting that terrorist elements operate from Afghan soil.

Bullets and business: How Gujaratis run killer motel dhandho in USGujaratis own over 60% of motels in the US. But the killing of seven Gujaratis linked to the motel business this year reveals the occupational hazards. Motel owners from the US share how they have managed to run the dhandho successfully despite increasing gun violence and racism.

Likely espionage: Nobel institute flags leak before Maria Machado prize revealThe Nobel Institute has flagged unusual betting activity ahead of Maria Corina Machado's Peace Prize win, with officials saying espionage is "highly likely", though no internal leak has been confirmed.

No violence against Hindus in Bangladesh, it's Indian fake news: YunusMuhammad Yunus dismissed several international reports of communal violence against Hindus in Bangladesh following the fall of the Sheikh Hasina government last year, calling them "fake news" floated by India.

From teen bride to having Princess Diana as client: The Shahnaz Husain storyFrom marrying at 15 to building a global beauty legacy and even counting Princess Diana as a client, we sit down with Shahnaz Husain to talk motherhood, family, Ayurveda, and giving back, basically, Anything But work.

Not afraid to fight: China vows countermeasures after Trump slaps 100% tariffsChina accused the United States of "arbitrary double standards" after President Donald Trump announced sweeping trade measures, including a 100% tariff on all Chinese imports and new export controls on critical US-made software starting November 1.

Cops barge into engineer's job party in Bhopal, beat him to death over Rs 10,000Eyewitnesses claim the constables stripped Udit and repeatedly assaulted him with sticks. He began vomiting shortly after, prompting his friends to rush him to a local hospital. Medical staff later referred him to AIIMS, but doctors declared him dead on arrival.

Nobel economists Abhijit Banerjee and Esther Duflo to leave US amid funding cutsNobel laureates Esther Duflo and Abhijit Banerjee will join the University of Zurich in 2026 to lead a new Lemann Center for Development Economics, marking a major global academic milestone.

Man recalls how a city breaks yet builds one in his viral farewell post for DelhiShubh, who had come to Delhi to prepare for the UPSC exam, wrote a deeply personal note about his time there, calling it both wholesome and painful.

Reinspect emergency system: Aviation body to Air India after Dreamliner scareThe aviation regulator has ordered Air India to reinspect Ram Air Turbine (RAT) systems on Boeing 787s days after an 'uncommanded' deployment took place on Flight AI 117 from Amritsar to Birmingham earlier this month.
Hamas to skip Gaza peace deal signing, calls Trump's proposals absurd: ReportHamas will skip the Gaza peace deal signing in Egypt, calling proposals for its members' departure from Gaza "absurd".

The incident follows a similar theft reported days earlier from a Jain religious event near the Red Fort.

How you hold your phone can reveal a lot about your mental healthLooking down at your screens or reading the most interesting book in a slouched manner can actually weigh heavily on your mental health. Science and experts back it up.

Sarfaraz and his father underwent a lifestyle change as the Mumbai batter started to work on his fitness in a bid to make his way back into the Indian team.

England still not at their best despite big win over Sri Lanka: Nat Sciver-BruntEngland captain Nat Sciver-Brunt scored a record-breaking century to help her team thrash Sri Lanka by 89 runs in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup. Despite the big win, she highlighted the need for stronger partnerships in the middle overs for consistent performances.

One of the most difficult moments in our history: USA cricket on ICC suspensionUSA Cricket has entered a challenging period after its suspension by the ICC and bankruptcy filing, citing a dispute with American Cricket Enterprise and a focus on safeguarding the sport's integrity in the US.

Watch: Fans, dressing room erupt as Namibia stun South Africa in maiden T20I tieNamibia secured an incredible win over South Africa in their first T20I tie against the Proteas on Saturday, October 11. The fans and the Namibian dressing room erupted as Zane Green hit the winning runs.

Courtesy of their win, they rose to the top of the points table with their third successive win.

Can Pakistan make winning start in redemption journey against world champions?PAK vs SA: Shan Masood's Pakistan and Aiden Markram's South Africa are all set to lock horns in a two-match Test series, starting October 12 at the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore.

Watch: Nat Sciver-Brunt dedicates century to newborn with cradle celebrationNat Sciver-Brunt stole the spotlight with a heartwarming 'Bebeto' baby-rocking celebration for her newborn after scoring her 10th ODI century against Sri Lanka in the Women's World Cup.

Jadeja praises Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal: Young generation taking responsibilityRavindra Jadeja heaped praise on Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal after their hundreds in the ongoing Delhi Test against West Indies. Jaiswal and Gill's hundreds helped India post a mammoth total of 518 runs in the first innings of the second Test.

Shubman Gill has shown great composure after being given captaincy: Anil KumbleLegendary India leg spinner Anil Kumble has said that Shubman Gill has shown great composure after being given the India captaincy. Gill scored his fifth century as skipper on Day 2 of the second Test against West Indies at Arun Jaitley in Delhi.

Alyssa Healy pins hopes on trump card Sophie Molineux to deliver vs IndiaAlyssa Healy expects Sophie Molineux to play a key role as Australia take on India in Sunday's Women's World Cup clash in Vizag. Australia, atop the points table, hope to leverage favourable conditions and a sold-out crowd for an exciting contest.

Compete against yourself: Neeraj Chopra gets key advice from Olympic legend Carl LewisOlympic legend Carl Lewis advised Neeraj Chopra to start competing against himself to remain on top of the world. Neeraj had an up and down season in 2025 as he lost his crown at the World Athletics Championships.

Exclusive: Avani Lekhara On Para-Athletics In India & Her Training For Upcoming World CupIn this India Today special report, star para-shooter Avani Lekhara discusses her recent ramp walk in Delhi, secret preparations for the 2026 season, and managing the pressure of expectations. On the nervousness that comes with being a top athlete, Lekhara stated, 'second Paralympics was much tougher than the first one and I think it will be same for him as well and we were going with a lot of expectations and there was nervousness, there was jitters...'. She reveals she is training for an upcoming World Cup in the UAE this month. Lekhara also details a significant overhaul of her equipment, including a new rifle and shooting wheelchair, as she prepares for the 2026 Asian Para Games and World Para Shooting Championships. She shares her perspective on the growth of para-sports in India, following the country's record medal haul at the recent World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
